thread.title: French soldier shoots suspected attacker at Louvre museum: reports
thread.title_full: French soldier shoots suspected attacker at Louvre museum: reports

title: French soldier shoots suspected attacker at Louvre museum: reports
text:
Paris: French soldier shoots suspected attacker at Louvre museum: reports Updated February 03, 2017 20:47:50 Map: France 
A French soldier has opened fire on and wounded a man armed with a knife after he tried to enter the Louvre Museum in central Paris carrying a suitcase, police sources have said. 
One source said the man had been trying to get into the museum's underground shop and had attacked another soldier before being shot and seriously wounded. 
Police said the area had been evacuated. 
The Interior Ministry said on Twitter the incident was "serious" and requested that people follow the advice of official security accounts and not broadcast fake information. 
A spokeswoman for Louvre said the museum was "closed for the moment" but would not confirm reports it had been evacuated. 
A Reuters witness at the scene said police had cordoned off access to the museum. 
France has been hit by a series of militant Islamist attacks over the past two years. 
ABC/wires First posted February 03, 2017 20:33:56 Top Stories
